title: Paul Philipp
text:
Paul Philipp (born 21 October 1950) is a former <a href="Luxembourg">Luxembourg</a>ian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Soccer%20player">player</a> and <a href="manager%20%28football%29">manager</a>.
He is the president of the <a href="Luxembourg%20Football%20Federation">Luxembourg Football Federation</a>.
Club career.
As a player, Philipp started his career at local club <a href="FC%20Avenir%20Beggen">Avenir Beggen</a> before moving to <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a> to play for 3 different teams in 13 seasons there. He finished his career back at Avenir in 1985.
International career.
He made his debut for <a href="Luxembourg%20national%20football%20team">Luxembourg</a> in 1968 and went on to earn 54 caps, scoring 4 goals. He played in 17 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches.
Manager career.
Philipp managed <a href="FC%20Avenir%20Beggen">Avenir Beggen</a> before managing the <a href="Luxembourg%20national%20football%20team">Luxembourgian national team</a> between 1985 and 2001, during which time the team won three matches, all in the <a href="1996%20UEFA%20European%20Football%20Championship%20qualifying">1996 European Championship qualifying round</a>, one of which was an upset win over the Czech Republic. The two other were against Malta, home and away.
